properties.name: Adam Road Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1974, Adam Food Centre comprises 32 cooked food stalls.  Although small in size, the hawker centre has a huge reputation.  Popular food offered in the centre includes BBQ Seafood, Nasi Lemak, Prawn Noodles etc.

properties.name: Aljunied Ave 2 Blk 117 (Blk 117 Aljunied Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Next to Geylang East Swimming Complex and other amenities, the hawker centre caters to the marketing and dining needs of the residents at Geylang East. The centre was built in 1978 and comprises 79 cooked food stalls and 82 market stalls.

properties.name: Amoy Street Food Centre (Telok Ayer Food Centre)
properties.address_myenv: National Development Building, Annex B, Telok Ayer Street, Singapore 069111
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1983, the two-storey food centre is located within the central business district.  Housing many well-known stalls, the centre has evolved into a favourite lunch venue for executives working near Shenton Way. Be spoilt by the choice of hawker fare at affordable prices!

properties.name: Anchorvale Village Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: Anchorvale Village Hawker Centre commenced operation in June 2024. It is located on level 2 of Anchorvale Village and has 36 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 1 Blk 226D (Kebun Baru Market and Food Centre)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 226D, Ang Mo Kio Ave 1, Singapore 564226
properties.description_myenv: Located next to a food centre, the hawker centre at Block 226D Ang Mo Kio Ave 1 serves the marketing and dining needs of residents living in the Kebun Baru area. The centre was upgraded in 2010 and consists predominantly of market stalls.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 1 Blk 341 (Teck Ghee Court)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 341, Ang Mo Kio Ave 1, Singapore 560341
properties.description_myenv: Located in the heart of Teck Ghee estate and opposite Bishan Park, the 32 cooked food stalls and 86 market stalls within the hawker centre remain a popular choice among patrons despite the availability of alternative marketing and dining facilities nearby.  Popular local dishes are whipped up daily to satisfy patrons' desires for good food!

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 Blk 409 (Teck Ghee Square)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 409, Ang Mo Kio Ave 10, Singapore 560409
properties.description_myenv: Also known as Teck Ghee Square, it is one of the three hawker centres that are situated along Ang Mo Kio Ave 10. Built in 1979, the hawker centre comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 148 market stalls.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 Blk 453A (Chong Boon Market and Food Centre)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 453A, Ang Mo Kio Ave 10, Singapore 561453
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 453A Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 consists of 38 cooked food stalls and 184 market stalls.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 Blk 527 (Cheng San Market and Cooked Food Centre)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 527, Ang Mo Kio Ave 10, Singapore 560527
properties.description_myenv: Commonly known as Cheng San Market and Cooked Food Centre, Blk 527 Ang Mo Kio Ave 10 is one of the three hawker centres located along Ang Mo Kio Ave 10. The hawker centre was built in 1979 to serve the dining and marketing needs of nearby residents. Upgraded in 2004, it houses 50 cooked food stalls and 100 market stalls.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 4 Blk 160/162 (Mayflower Market)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 160/162, Ang Mo Kio Ave 4, Singapore 560160/560162
properties.description_myenv: Commonly known as Mayflower Market, the hawker centre was built in 1981. It comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 84 market stalls to serve the marketing and dining needs of residents.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 4 Blk 628 (Ang Mo Kio 628 Market)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 628, Ang Mo Kio Ave 4, Singapore 560628
properties.description_myenv: Originally built in 1979, the hawker centre is located opposite Yio Chu Kang CC and near schools, temples and residential flats.   After the upgrading in 2010, the rebuilt centre consists of  52 cooked food stalls and 166 market stalls to serve the marketingand dining needs of patrons.

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Ave 6 Blk 724 (Blk 724 Ang Mo Kio Market)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 724, Ang Mo Kio Ave 6, Singapore 560724
properties.description_myenv: Located conveniently in the heart of the bustling Ang Mo Kio Town Centre, the hawker centre is always packed with patrons, especially during the weekends.  Be prepared to queue for your favourite food at popular stalls!

properties.name: Ang Mo Kio Street 22 Blk 226H (Kebun Baru Food Centre)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 226H, Ang Mo Kio Street 22, Singapore 568226
properties.description_myenv: Commonly known as Kebun Bahru Food Centre, the food centre was built in 1976 to serve the dining needs of Kebun Baru residents. Comprises 29 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Bedok Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located at the corner of Upper East Coast Road, Bedok Food Centre is a favourite haunt for residents in the vicinity and army personnel from nearby barracks. Upgraded in 2005, the fa?ade resembles that of an old Malay "kampong" house. Famous for hawker fare such as Hokkien Mee, Desserts, Malay Dishes and more, the hawker centre houses 32 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Bedok North Street 1 Blk 216
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 216 Bedok North Street 1 comprises 82 cooked food stalls and 114 market stalls. A stone's throw away from Bedok Town Centre.

properties.name: Bedok North Street 3 Blk 511 (Kaki Bukit 511 Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 511 Bedok North Street 3 comprises 42 cooked food stalls and 83 market stalls to serve both the dining and marketing needs of residents living in the Kaki Bukit area. Be pampered by the wide selection of hawker fare!  Crowded during dinner and supper hours.

properties.name: Bedok North Street 3 Blk 538
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1979, the hawker centre at Blk 538 Bedok North Street 3 comprises 42 cooked food stalls and 134 market stalls. One of the popular hawker centres in the Bedok area.

properties.name: Bedok North Street 4 Blk 85 (85 Fengshan Centre)
properties.description_myenv: A popular supper destination for night owls from all over the island.  The hawker centre features a wide array of hawker fare such as Bak Chor Mee, Porridge, BBQ Chicken Wings and Seafood, Fried Oysters etc.  Definitely a favourite haunt for the sleepless!

properties.name: Bedok Reservoir Road Blk 630
properties.description_myenv: Located within walking distance from the Eunos Community Club, the centre is a convenient place which meets the dining and marketing needs of residents living at Bedok Reservoir Road. Upgraded in 2006, it houses 36 cooked food stalls and 75 market stalls.

properties.name: Bedok South Road Blk 16
properties.description_myenv: Located near schools, factories and housing estates in the Bedok South area, this hawker centre is an accessible hotspot for patrons looking for an economical meal.

properties.name: Bendemeer Road Blk 29 (Bendemeer Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Just a few minutes away from Boon Keng MRT station, the hawker centre is very popular with the nearby residents as well as the workers at Kallang Bahru Industrial Estate because of its location and affordable local cuisines.

properties.name: Beo Crescent Market
properties.description_myenv: Located near to Tiong Bahru MRT station and PSB Academy, Beo Crescent Market/Food Centre was built in 1965.  The centre serves the mature estate of Havelock and Tiong Bahru area.

properties.name: Berseh Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located along Jalan Besar Road, Berseh Food Centre houses 66 cooked food stalls. Built in 1975, the food centre presents an added nostalgic flavour with the rows of meticulously restored pre-war shophouses surrounding it.

properties.name: Boon Lay Place Blk 221A/B (Boon Lay Place Market and Food Village)
properties.description_myenv: Located beside Boon Lay Shopping Centre, the hawker centre at Blk 221A/B Boon Lay Place provides marketing and dining amenities for residents living in Boon Lay. Built in 1976, the centre comprises 72 cooked food stalls and 94 market stalls.

properties.name: Buangkok Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Buangkok Hawker Centre commenced operations in Nov 2023. It is located on the 2nd level of Sengkang Grand Mall and will feature 38 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Buffalo Road Blk 665 (Tekka Centre/Zhu Jiao Market)
properties.description_myenv: More commonly known as Tekka Centre, the hawker centre is a popular haunt for marketing and dining needs, especially with the Indian community. An amazing variety of fresh produce is sold at the market.  Built in 1980, it is the second largest hawker centre in Singapore housing more than 400 stalls. An iconic landmark in the Little India area!

properties.name: Bukit Canberra Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Bukit Canberra Hawker Centre commenced operation in December 2022.It is located within the Bukit Canberra Integrated Sport and Community Hub.The centre has 44 cooked food stalls.  For more information, please refer to https://bukitcanberrahc.sg

properties.name: Bukit Merah Central Blk 163 (Bukit Merah Central Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located in the heart of Bukit Merah Central, the food centre consists of 57 cooked food stalls. Extremely well liked by office executives working in the vicinity, the centre bustles with activity during lunch hours. Popular dishes include Ngoh Hiang, Chicken Rice, Teochew Porridge, Fish Soup, Char Kway Teow and Goreng Pisang. Be prepared to be spoilt for choice!

properties.name: Bukit Merah Lane 1 Blk 120 (Alexandra Village Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Opposite the Queenstown Shopping Centre, the hawker centre, also commonly known as Alexandra Food Village, is home to a number of "yummylicious" local dishes such as Chicken Rice, Claypot Laksa, Bak Ku Teh etc.

properties.name: Bukit Merah View Blk 115 (Blk 115 Bukit Merah View Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1973, the hawker centre comprises 84 cooked food stalls and 98 market produce stalls. Located in Henderson area and near to office buildings, schools and residential flats, it is one of the largest hawker centres in Bukit Merah.

properties.name: Bukit Panjang Hawker Centre and Market
properties.description_myenv: The Bukit Panjang Hawker Centre and Market commenced operation in December 2015.  It is a standalone hawker centre with 28 cooked food stalls, 14 market slab stalls and 14 lock-up stalls across two levels.  It also has a sundry store on the second floor.

properties.name: Bukit Timah Market
properties.description_myenv: Located along Upper Bukit Timah Road, the two-storey hawker centre was built in 1975 and was upgraded in 2003. A popular hawker centre serving the dining and marketing needs of residents living around Toh Yi Drive. Well-known for the variety of hawker fare, the centre is usually packed with patrons during peak hours. Comprises 84 cooked food stalls and 94 market stalls.

properties.name: Cambridge Road Blk 41A (Pek Kio Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: More commonly known as Pek Kio Market and Food Centre, the hawker centre was built in 1981 to serve residents staying nearby.  The centre was upgraded in 2003 and currently houses 50 cooked food stalls and 74 market stalls. Many stalls offer delicious yet suprisingly affordable dishes. Get ready for a gastronomic experience!

properties.name: Changi Village Blk 2 and 3
properties.description_myenv: Located at the eastern end of Singapore near to Changi Point Ferry Terminal and Changi Beach, the popular hawker centre draws food lovers from all over the island. Be wowed by the great variety of  hawker fare available e.g. Nasi Lemak, BBQ Seafood, Fried Wan Ton Noodles etc.  Built in 1975, this centre comprises 87 cooked food stalls and 50 market stalls.

properties.name: Chomp Chomp Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located in Serangoon Gardens, Chomp Chomp Food Centre is well-known for its vibrant dinner and supper scene. Bustling with diners even till late at night, the 36 cooked food stalls in the small hawker centre serve popular local dishes such as Char Kway Teow, BBQ Chicken Wings, Seafood etc. This Centre attracts food lovers from all over the island.

properties.name: Ci Yuan Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Ci Yuan Hawker Centre commenced operation in August 2015 and is a co-located centre within the Ci Yuan Community Club and has 40 cooked food stalls.  For more information, please refer to: https://ciyuanhawker.com.sg

properties.name: Circuit Road Blk 79/79A
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1971, the hawker centre is sited beside the Pelton Canal in Paya Lebar. One of the three hawker centres at Ciruit Road, the centre comprises 106 cooked food stalls. After upgrading in 2010, a new outdoor refreshment area has been added to provide a unique alfresco dining experience to patrons.

properties.name: Circuit Road Blk 80 (80 Circuit Road Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1967, the hawker centre at Blk 80 Circuit Road comprises 16 cooked food stalls and 43 market stalls. One of the three hawker centres serving the residents living in the vicinity of Circuit Road.

properties.name: Circuit Road Blk 89
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1967, the hawker centre at Blk 89 Circuit Road comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 93 market stalls. One of the three hawker centres serving the residents living in the vicinity of Circuit Road.

properties.name: Clementi Ave 2 Blk 353 (Clementi Ave 2 Market/Cooked Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1978, the hawker centre has evolved into a focal point for residents to dine and engage in social bonding. Blk 353 Clementi Ave 2 comprises 18 cooked food stalls and 96 market stalls.

properties.name: Clementi Ave 3 Blk 448
properties.description_myenv: Located in the town centre of Clementi, the hawker centre at Blk 448 Clementi Ave 3 is within walking distance from Clementi MRT station and the bus interchange. Good food offerings and its strategic location make the centre popular with diners.

properties.name: Clementi West Street 2 Blk 726
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1980, the hawker centre at Blk 726 Clementi West Street 2 consists of 60 cooked food stalls and 135 market stalls. The centre is conveniently located in close proximity to schools, housing estates and shopping complex.

properties.name: Commonwealth Crescent Market
properties.description_myenv: The 63 market stalls are located on the lower level while the 39 cooked food stalls are located on the upper level of this two-storey market. Built in 1965 to fulfill the marketing and dining needs of residents living in the mature estate of Commonwealth Drive.

properties.name: Dunman Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1974, Dunman Food Centre has since played a vital role in providing resonably-priced cuisines to the residents of Joo Chiat area. Upgraded in 2002, the centre comprises 30 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: East Coast Lagoon Food Village
properties.description_myenv: Located in the south-eastern part of Singapore, the East Coast Lagoon Food Village offers a tropical resort ambience by the sea and a wide variety of local hawker food at reasonable prices. It is a favourite haunt among sports enthusiasts and families who wish to enjoy a sumptuous meal by the sea. Popular dishes include Satay, BBQ Seafood and Chicken Wings, Zi Char, Wan Ton Noodles, Satay Bee Hoon, Beef Noodles etc.  Rated as one of the food paradises in Singapore!

properties.name: Empress Road Blk 7 (Empress Road Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1976, the hawker centre at Blk 7 Empress Road comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 72 market stalls. Provides marketing and dining facilities to residents of Farrer estate.

properties.name: Eunos Crescent Blk 4A
properties.description_myenv: The hawker centre at Blk 4A Eunos Crescent is located within close proximity to the Eunos MRT station and bus interchange. Its strategic location coupled with a wide variety of food offerings results in high patronage especially during lunch and dinner hours.

properties.name: Fernvale Hawker Centre and Market
properties.description_myenv: The Fernvale Hawker Centre and Market commenced operation in July 2022.  It is a co-located centre within the Fernvale Community Club.  It has 28 cooked food stalls and a market section.

properties.name: Geylang Bahru Blk 69 (Blk 69 Geylang Bahru Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located near amenities such as swimming pool, industrial parks, commercial shops and residential estates, Blk 69 Geylang Bahru is a focal point where patrons get to enjoy local hawker fare at affordable prices. The hawker centre was built in 1974 and houses 84 cooked food stalls cum 127 market stalls.

properties.name: Geylang Serai Market
properties.description_myenv: One of the most popular hawker centres in Singapore, especially with the Malay community! The hawker centre was upgraded in 2009 and currently comprises 63 cooked food stalls and 302 market stalls. Its design, which was conceived after close consultations with grassroots and stallholders, is reminiscent of rural Malay architecture. It is the third biggest hawker centre in Singapore based on stall count.

properties.name: Ghim Moh Road Blk 20
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1977, the hawker centre is famous for its wide spread of offerings such as Char Kway Teow, Chicken Rice, Soya Bean Drinks etc. 72 cooked food stalls and 158 market stalls at the hawker centre serve Ghim Moh  residents daily.

properties.name: Golden Mile Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Home to lock-up stalls selling army stuff, Golden Mile Food Centre is a "must go" place if you are looking for affordable army / camping equipment. The food section located at the first and second levels definitely does not pale in comparison. It offers well-known local and international cuisines by 111 cooked food stalls. Fanciful food selection at great prices!

properties.name: Haig Road Blk 13/14 (Haig Road Market and Cooked Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1977, the hawker centre at Blk 13/14 Haig Road is easily visible from Changi Road. Comprising 72 cooked food stalls and 146 market stalls, its ideal location as well as the wide selection of affordable hawker fare have attracted many residents and working professionals around the vicinity.

properties.name: Havelock Road Blk 22A/B (Havelock Road Cooked Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1971, the standalone hawker centre located in the Havelock area comprises 30 cooked food stalls. It went through HUP in 2005.

properties.name: Holland Drive Blk 44 (Holland Drive Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: One of the last hawker centres to be built, Blk 44 Holland Drive has been serving the needs of residents since 1999. The two-storey hawker centre houses a market at the lower level and a food centre on the upper level. Conveniently located within walking distance from the Buona Vista MRT station.

properties.name: Holland Village Market and Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Situated right in the heart of Holland Village, the hawker centre was built in the pre-war years. One of the hawker centres with the longest history in Singapore! Surrounded by restaurants and bistros, the hawker centre remains a popular choice for patrons with its offering of affordable hawker fare. Comprises 21 cooked food stalls and 48 market stalls.

properties.name: Hougang Ave 1 Blk 105 (Hougang 105 Hainanese Village Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Also known as Hougang 105 Hainanese Village Centre, the hawker centre underwent a major facelift in 2005. A very popular hawker centre in the Hougang area, especially during the weekends. Serving the needs of both the residents of Lorong Ah Soo as well as the industrial area across at Defu Lane, there are currently 51 cooked food stalls and 120 market stalls within the centre.

properties.name: Hougang Street 21 Blk 209 (Kovan Hougang Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Conveniently situated in the heartlands of Kovan, the hawker centre at Blk 209 Hougang Street 21 is minutes away from Kovan MRT. Built in 1983, the centre houses 65 cooked food stalls and 118 market stalls. Be prepared to queue for your favourite dish at the popular cooked food stalls within the hawker centre!

properties.name: Jalan Batu Blk 4A (Blk 4A Jalan Batu Hawker Centre/Market)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1969, Blk 4A Jalan Batu comprises both a market and food section. The centre houses 52 cooked food stalls and 53 market stalls.

properties.name: Jalan Bukit Merah Blk 112 (Blk 112 Jalan Bukit Merah Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Situated in the mature estate of Jalan Bukit Merah, the hawker centre at Blk 112 Jalan Bukit Merah satisfies both the marketing and dining needs of the residents nearby.

properties.name: Jalan Bukit Merah Blk 6 (ABC Brickworks Market/Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Fondly known as ABC Brickworks Market, it is within close proximity to Alexandra Food Village and IKEA. The hawker centre, which was built in 1974, is another alternative for the residents of Queenstown and Bukit Merah.  Patrons can find delicious yet affordable hawker fare at the centre.

properties.name: Jalan Kukoh Blk 1 (Kukoh 21 Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1969, Blk 1 Jalan Kukoh used to consist of both a market and food section. After upgrading in 2010, the centre was converted to a food centre with 21 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Jurong East Ave 1 Blk 347 (Yuhua Market and Hawker Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located near to the PIE exit (Jurong Town Hall Road), the hawker centre at Blk 347 Jurong East Ave 1 is popular with residents living in the area. A wide variety of food and market produce is offered at the hawker centre by the 56 cooked food stalls and 169 market stalls. It was built in 1984 to cater to the dining and marketing needs of residents.

properties.name: Jurong East Street 24 Blk 254 (Yuhua Village Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located near to the PIE exit (Jurong Town Hall Road), the hawker centre at Blk 254 Jurong East Street 24 serves the marketing and dining needs of residents living in Yuhua Village.  There are 60 cooked food stalls and 87 market produce stalls operating within the hawker centre. Originally built in 1983.

properties.name: Jurong West Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Jurong West Hawker Centre re-commenced operation in September 2023. It is conveniently located next to the Pioneer Mall and will feature 39 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Jurong West Street 52 Blk 505
properties.description_myenv: The hawker centre at Blk 505 Jurong West Street 52 was built in 1985.  Located in the heart of the Jurong West estate, the centre serves patrons from the nearby residential flats and schools.  Last upgraded in 2009, the centre comprises a total of 190 stalls - 60 cooked food and 130 market stalls.

properties.name: Kallang Estate Fresh Market and Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located just minutes away from Blk 51 Old Airport Road, the Kallang Estate Fresh Market and Food Centre provides both dining and marketing services for Kallang residents. Built in 1959, the centre comprises 16 cooked food stalls and 78 market stalls.

properties.name: Kampung Admiralty Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Kampung Admiralty Hawker Centre commenced operation in August 2017.It has 43 cooked food stalls and is conveniently located beside the Admiralty MRT Station and a stone's throw from the Woodlands Galaxy Community Club.

properties.name: Margaret Drive Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: Margaret Drive Food Centre commenced business operations on 1 Aug 2022.With 38 cooked food stalls, all of which were relocated from Commonwealth Drive Food Centre, residents of Commonwealth and Queenstown will enjoy a variety of local dishes with a sense of familiarity.

properties.name: Marine Parade Central Blk 84 (84 Marine Parade Central Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located across Parkway Parade Shopping Centre, the hawker centre has been around since 1976. It is popular with patrons throughout the day. A wide variety of local food is available at the hawker centre including Char Kway Teow, Beef Noodles, Economical Rice, Desserts etc.  Comprises 55 cooked food stalls and 143 market stalls.

properties.name: Marine Terrace Blk 50A (50A Marine Terrace)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1975 to serve the residents living within the Marine Terrace estate. The hawker centre is located just next to the Marine Parade Town Council. Comprises 24 cooked food stalls and 87 market stalls.

properties.name: Market Street Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located next to Raffles Place MRT Station, Market Street Hawker Centre is housed on the second and third levels of CapitaSpring Building. With 56 cooked food stalls spread over these two levels, patrons visiting the business district may enjoy a good variety of delicious local hawker fare. It is quite a common sight to see crowds, especially during lunch hours from Mondays to Fridays.

properties.name: Marsiling Lane Blk 20/21
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1975, the hawker centre at Blk 20/21 Marsiling Road houses 52 cooked food stalls and 112 market stalls.  Upgraded in 2009.

properties.name: Marsiling Mall Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: Built in 2017, and located close to the heart of Woodlands, Marsiling Mall Hawker Centre offers residents convenient access to a variety of good and affordable hawker food. This hawker centre is also situated adjacent to Woodlands Sports Centre, bringing hawker food to the doorstep of sports facility users.

properties.name: Maxwell Food Centre (Kim Hua Market)
properties.description_myenv: Maxwell Food Centre began its roots in 1935. One of the iconic hawker centres in Singapore, the food centre now consists of 103 cooked food stalls. Popular hawker fare such as Chicken Rice, Tapioca Kueh, Porridge, Desserts and more can be found here.

properties.name: Mei Chin Road Blk 159 (Mei Chin Road Market)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1970 to serve the Mei Ling estate, the hawker centre at Blk 159 Mei Chin Road was upgraded in 2009 to improve circulation space and ventilation. Comprises 47 cooked food stalls and 66 market stalls.

properties.name: New Market Road Blk 32 (People's Park Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Fondly known as People's Park Complex, it is located right in the heart of the bustling Chinatown. It is a favourite haunt for elderly folks to catch up and enjoy a delicious yet affordable meal.  Extremely accessible by bus or MRT. Upgraded in 2005, it has 87 cooked food stalls located on the ground floor. The second and third floors comprise HDB shops selling fabrics, fashion and home wares.

properties.name: New Upper Changi Road Blk 208B (Bedok Interchange Hawker Centre)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 208B, New Upper Changi Road, Singapore 462208
properties.description_myenv: Completed in 2014, this new food centre replaces the hawker centre at Blk 207 Upper Changi Road.  Also know as Bedok Interchange Hawker Centre,  it houses more seating areas for diners, more parking lots at the adjacent multi-storey carpark, and high-volume, low-speed cooling fans to provide patrons a more comfortable and cooler dining experience.  The centre also has NETS cashless payment system implemented at food stalls and free wireless internet connection via Wireless@SG for the convenience of patrons.

properties.name: New Upper Changi Road Blk 58
properties.address_myenv: Blk 58, New Upper Changi Road, Singapore 461058
properties.description_myenv: Comprising a market produce and cooked food section, the hawker centre at Blk 58 New Upper Changi Road was built in 1978 to serve the marketing and dining needs of patrons living in Bedok South. Especially popular during the breakfast and lunch hours.

properties.name: Newton Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Popular with both locals and tourists alike.  Often rated by foodies as one of the best hawker centres in Singapore, Newton Food Centre is well known for dishes like BBQ Seafood, Hokkien Mee, Po Piah, Satay, Fried Carrot Cake etc.  Extremely crowded during dinner and supper time, this is definitely a hawker centre that you must visit!  Located in the Cairnhill / Newton area and a stone's throw away from Newton MRT.

properties.name: North Bridge Road Market
properties.description_myenv: Originally built in 1973 as a two-storey building. North Bridge Road Market was converted into a single-storey hawker centre after its upgrading in 2005. The centre now comprises 37 cooked food stalls and 82 market stalls.

properties.name: Old Airport Road Blk 51 (51 Old Airport Road Food Centre and Shopping Mall)
properties.description_myenv: The renowned Blk 51 Old Airport Road is famed for its excellent yet affordable food. Built in 1973, it consists of 168 cooked food stalls on the ground level and 54 lock-up stalls on the second level. The large number of cooked food stalls serve up an amazing array of cuisines, from local hawker fare to international food. Get thrilled by the gastronomic experience offered by the numerous stalls!

properties.name: One Punggol Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The One Punggol Hawker Centre commenced operation in October 2022 and is located on level 2 of the One Punggol Integrated Hub.It has 34 cooked food stalls.For more information, please refer to https://onepunggolhc.sg

properties.name: Pasir Panjang Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Situated along Pasir Panjang Road and near to industrial estates, the food centre comprises 45 cooked food stalls and serves a variety of hawker fare including BBQ Seafood and Zi Char. Built in 1978.

properties.name: Pasir Ris Central Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Pasir Ris Central Hawker Centre commenced operation in January 2018 and is located within the Pasir Ris Town Park.The centre has 42 cooked food stalls across two levels.

properties.name: Queen Street Blk 270 (Albert Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Strategically located near places of interests like the famous Guan Yin Temple and Bugis Village, the hawker centre is popular with both locals and tourists alike. A wide array of good local cuisines is served by well-known stalls operating at the hawker centre.  The hawker centre is also famous for dried seafood items and textiles, sold at the lock-up stalls withiin the market section.

properties.name: Redhill Lane Blk 79 (Redhill Market)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1969, the standalone market offers a variety of fresh market produce to serve the needs of Redhill residents. The centre was upgraded in 2005 and comprises 122 market stalls.  Within walking distance from Redhill MRT.

properties.name: Redhill Lane Blk 85 (Redhill Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Build in 1972 to complement the market next door, Blk 85 Redhill Lane is a standalone food centre comprising 96 cooked food stalls. A good variety of food can be found within the hawker centre.  Within walking distance from Redhill MRT.

properties.name: Sembawang Hills Food Centre (Jalan Leban Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1974, this centre is nestled along Upper Thomson Road and offers a wide variety of food such as Fish / Seafood Soup, Char Kway Teow, Ngoh Hiang, Pasta etc.  The centre comprises 36 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Senja Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Senja Hawker Centre commenced operation in December 2022.It has 28 cooked food stalls on level 2 and a roof garden on level 3.

properties.name: Serangoon Garden Market
properties.description_myenv: Within walking distance from the famous Chomp Chomp Food Centre, the spacious Serangoon Garden Market is an alternative food paradise where residents satisfy their palates.  Equipped also with a market produce section, patrons can discover true gems within the centre.  Take a look around and you can't miss those stalls that are highly rated by food gurus!

properties.name: Shunfu Road Blk 320 (Shunfu Mart)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 2001, the hawker centre at Blk 320 Shunfu Road is the last hawker centre to be built. Also known as Shunfu Mart, the centre houses 31 cooked food stalls and 51 market stalls.

properties.name: Sims Place Blk 49 (Sims Vista Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Also known as Sims Vista Market and Food Centre, the hawker centre is nestled within the idyllic Sims Vista estate. Originally built in 1976, the hawker centre was upgraded in 2006 to improve its physical facade and provide a more hygienic environment for both stallholders and patrons alike. 66 cooked food stalls and 78 market stalls serve patrons of the hawker centre.

properties.name: Smith Street Blk 335 (Chinatown Complex Market)
properties.description_myenv: Original built in 1983, Blk 335 Smith Street is also commonly known as Chinatown Complex. It is the largest hawker centre in Singapore comprising a total of 703 stalls! After upgrading in 2008, the building has been transformed into an architecture of strong Chinese influence with a modern twist. Situated in the Chinatown area, the centre now comes with better amenities and increased seating capacity. A favourite hang-out place for residents to reminisce good old days while enjoying the wide array of local dishes offered.

properties.name: Taman Jurong Market and Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Taman Jurong Market and Food Centre is an amalgamation of  3 hawker centres, namely Corporation Drive Market, Yung Sheng Food Centre and Corporation Drive Food Centre. Comprises 123 cooked food stalls and 57 market stalls.

properties.name: Tampines Street 11 Blk 137 (Tampines Round Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Blk 137 Tampines Street 11 is the only hawker centre in the Tampines area. Also commonly known as Tampines Round Market due to the unique circular shape of the hawker centre, it was built in 1982 to fulfill the marketing and dining needs of the resident in Tampines Town. Comprises 45 cooked food stalls and 99 market stalls. The hawker centre was voted by readers of Shin Min Daily as their favourite hawker centre for 2 years running (2008-2009) in the City Hawker Food Hunt contest.

properties.name: Tanglin Halt Market
properties.description_myenv: Built way back in 1964, Tanglin Halt Market is an iconic hawker centre within the Tanglin Halt estate. The hawker centre was given a facelift in 2003, and currently comprises 28 cooked food stalls and 89 market stalls.

properties.name: Tanjong Pagar Plaza Blk 6 (Blk 6 Tanjong Pagar Plaza Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located near the Tanjong Pagar Plaza, the hawker centre serves some of the locals' favourite dishes such as Hainanese Chicken Rice, Curry Fish Head and Seafood Soup. Built in 1977, the centre has 52 cooked food stalls and 108 market stalls to serve the needs of the patrons.

properties.name: Teban Gardens Road Blk 37A (Teban Gardens Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Located near Pandan Reservoir, the hawker centre comprises 28 cooked food stalls and 52 market stalls.  Built in 1976 to serve residents staying nearby.

properties.name: Telok Blangah Crescent Blk 11 (11 Telok Blangah Crescent Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: The hawker centre was built in 1974 to serve the dining and marketing needs of residents living in the Telok Blangah area.  After its facelift in 2009, the upgraded centre boasts enhanced features such as ramps and wider circulation spaces for the physically challenged and elderly patrons.

properties.name: Telok Blangah Drive Blk 79 (Telok Blangah Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Situated directly opposite the Telok Blangah Community Centre, the hawker centre is a convenient location where residents of Telok Blangah can get to enjoy palatable local cuisines at affordable rates from the 40 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Telok Blangah Drive Blk 82 (Telok Blangah Market)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1972, the standalone market at Blk 82 Telok Blangah Drive offers a variety of fresh produce where residents can fulfill their marketing needs. Comprises 144 market stalls.

properties.name: Telok Blangah Rise Blk 36 (Telok Blangah Rise Market)
properties.description_myenv: Located near the scenic Mount Faber Park, the hawker centre has been serving the dining and marketing needs of residents in the vicinity since the 1970s.

properties.name: The Hawker Centre @ Our Tampines Hub
properties.description_myenv: The Hawker Centre @ Our Tampines Hub commenced operation in November 2016.It is located within Our Tampines Hub, an integrated community and lifestyle hub that offers a range of services and facilities.The hawker centre has 42 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Tiong Bahru Market
properties.description_myenv: Located in one of the oldest and most charming neighbourhoods, Tiong Bahru Market was built in 1950 as a single-storey centre.  The centre merged with Blk 84 and 84A Lim Liak Street during the upgrading in 2006, and was converted into a three-storey building: market stalls on the ground floor, cooked food stalls on the second floor and a carpark on the third. It is the fourth largest hawker centre in Singapore with 259 market stalls and 83 cooked food stalls! Well-known for the many popular stalls within the centre.

properties.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 1 Blk 127 (Toa Payoh West Market and Food Court)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1969, the two-storey hawker centre comprises 40 cooked food stalls and 108 market stalls. Well-known for hawker stalls such as Chicken Rice, Hokkien Mee etc, the hawker centre serves both the dining and marketing needs of Toa Payoh residents.

properties.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 4 Blk 74 (Toa Payoh Vista Market)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1968, the hawker centre at Blk 74 Lorong 4 Toa Payoh comprises 10 cooked food stalls and 80 market stalls. Located near to Toa Payoh central and HDB Hub.

properties.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 4 Blk 93
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1967, the hawker centre at Blk 93 Lorong 4 Toa Payoh comprises 28 cooked food stalls and 32 market stalls. Originally a double-storey building, the centre was converted to a single-storey one after upgrading in 2009.

properties.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 5 Blk 75
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1968, this standalone food centre at Blk 75 Lorong 5 Toa Payoh comprises 36 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 7 Blk 22 (Kim Keat Palm Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1970, the hawker centre at Blk 22 Lorong 7 Toa Payoh serves the Kim Keat residents and nearby industrial parks. There are 61 cooked food stalls and 59 market stalls in the hawker centre.  Be pampered by delicious hawker fare such as Oyster Omelette, Fishball Noodles, Zi Char etc!

properties.name: Toa Payoh Lorong 8 Blk 210
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1974, this hawker centre houses 80 cooked food stalls and 77 market stalls. One of the largest hawker centres in the Toa Payoh vicinity.

properties.name: Upper Boon Keng Road Blk 17 (Blk 17 Upper Boon Keng Market and Food Centre)
properties.address_myenv: Blk 17, Upper Boon Keng Road, Singapore 380017
properties.description_myenv: Upgraded in 2009, the hawker centre at Blk 17 Upper Boon Keng comprises 84 cooked food stalls and 60 market stalls. The hawker centre serves the nearby residential and industrial estates.

properties.name: Upper Cross Street Blk 531A (Hong Lim Food Centre and Market)
properties.description_myenv: Also known as Hong Lim Food Centre, the hawker centre is famous for dishes such as Bak Ku Teh, Crayfish Hor Fun, Curry Chicken Noodles, Fish Head Bee Hoon etc. Expect to see long queues at different stalls, especially during lunch hours. Apart from the 103 cooked food stalls, the hawker centre also has 40 market stalls to serve the needs of the residents in the vicinity.

properties.name: West Coast Drive Blk 502 (Ayer Rajah Market)
properties.description_myenv: Also known as Ayer Rajah Market, the standalone market is located next to Ayer Rajah Food Centre. One of the last few hawker centres built, construction was completed in 1995 to complement Ayer Rajah Food Centre. There are 68 market stalls at the market to serve the West Coast area.

properties.name: West Coast Drive Blk 503 (Ayer Rajah Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Also known as Ayer Rajah Food Centre, the standalone food centre was originally built in 1979.  The centre is located next to Ayer Rajah Market and currently houses 80 cooked food stalls to serve the West Coast area.

properties.name: Whampoa Drive Blk 90 (Whampoa Drive Makan Place/Whampoa Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Known also as Whampoa Drive Makan Place, this is one hawker centre in Singapore which has become inceasingly famous over the years. Patrons can easily find popular stalls serving up excellent dishes to satisfy their palate. Be prepared to wait during peak hours as the premise is packed with diners!

properties.name: Whampoa Drive Blk 91/92 (Whampoa Drive Makan Place/Whampoa Market)
properties.description_myenv: Known also as Whampoa Drive Makan Place, this is one hawker centre in Singapore which has become inceasingly famous over the years. Patrons can easily find popular stalls serving up excellent dishes to satisfy their palate. Be prepared to wait during peak hours as the premise is packed with diners!

properties.name: Woodleigh Village Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located next to the MRT station, Woodleigh Village Hawker Centre has 39 cooked food stalls.

properties.name: Yishun Park Hawker Centre
properties.description_myenv: The Yishun Park Hawker Centre commenced operation in September 2017 and is located across the Yishun Park. It has 45 cooked food stalls.For more information, please refer to https://yishunparkhc.sg

properties.name: Yishun Ring Road Blk 104/105 (Chong Pang Market and Food Centre)
properties.description_myenv: Built in 1984, the hawker centre comprises 56 cooked food stalls and 123 market stalls. Residents of Chong Pang patronise the centre for its wide selection of local cuisines.

properties.name: Zion Riverside Food Centre
properties.description_myenv: Located opposite Great World City, Zion Riverside Food Centre boasts a huge reputation even with its relatively small footprint of 32 cooked food stalls. Built since 1976, patrons can find a variety of good food offerings at the centre. Popular with both locals and tourists alike.
